title: The Self-made Billionaire Effect: How Extreme Producers
description:
John Sviokla, Mitch Cohen, "The Self-made Billionaire Effect: How Extreme Producers Create Massive Value"
ISBN: 159184763X, 0241199484 | 2014 | EPUB | 240 pages | 1 MB

Imagine what Atari might have achieved if Steve Jobs had stayed there to develop the first massmarket personal computer. Or what Steve Case might have done for PepsiCo if he hadnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t left for a gaming start-up that eventually became AOL. What if Salomon Brothers had kept Michael Bloomberg, or Bear Stearns had exploited the inventive ideas of Stephen Ross?

Scores of top-tier entrepreneurs worked for established corporations before they struck out on their own and became self-made billionaires. People like Mark Cuban, John Paul DeJoria, Sara Blakely, and T. Boone Pickens all built businessesÃ¢â‚¬â€in some cases, multiple businessesÃ¢â‚¬â€that are among todayÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s most iconic brands. This fact raises two profound questions: Why couldnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t their former employers hang on to to these extraordinarily talented people? And why are most big companies unable to create as much new value as the worldÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s roughly 800 self-made billionaires?
